required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Daily Wear Corneal Infiltrative Event Study
clinical_study.official_title: Infiltrative Events During Silicone Hydrogel Daily Contact Lens (Daily Wear Corneal Infiltrative Event (DWCIE) Study)

brief_summary.textblock: This DWCIE Study is a prospective cohort study of patients fit to the FDA approved and marketed lotrafilcon A (Ciba Vision, Air Optix Night & Day Aqua) soft contact lenses for daily wear (DW) with monthly disposal. 218 healthy myopic (nearsighted) or hyperopic (farsighted) patients with minimal or no astigmatism and no contraindications to DW lens use will be followed for 1 year. The primary outcome is the risk of development of a corneal inflammatory event (CIE) as defined by slit lamp findings and patient symptoms. The main exposure of interest is microbial contamination of study lenses.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Developing a Corneal Inflammatory Event (CIE)
primary_outcome.description: Raw number of participants in each solution arm developing CIE over 12 month follow-up period

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With CIE Stratified by Microbial Bioburden on Lenses
secondary_outcome.description: Microbial bioburden on lenses was determined with predetermined cutoffs to identify substantial bioburden as high levels of normal flora or presence of pathogenic abnormal flora on lenses

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With CIE Based Stratified by Presence or Absence of Corneal Staining Induced by Solution Use.
secondary_outcome.description: Presumed solution induced corneal staining was defined as diffuse punctate fluorescein staining of at least 15% surface area in at least 4 of 5 zones

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With CIE Stratified by Microbial Bioburden on Lens Cases
secondary_outcome.description: Microbial bioburden within lens storage cases was determined with predetermined cutoffs to identify substantial bioburden as high levels of normal flora or presence of pathogenic abnormal flora

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With CIE Stratified by Overall Microbial Bioburden on Lid Margins
secondary_outcome.description: Microbial bioburden on lid margins was determined with predetermined cutoffs to identify substantial bioburden as high levels of normal flora or presence of pathogenic abnormal flora on lids

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With CIE Stratified by CNS Microbial Bioburden on Lid Margins
secondary_outcome.description: Microbial bioburden with coagulase negative staphylococci (CNS) on lid margins was determined with predetermined cutoffs to identify substantial bioburden as high levels of normal CNS flora on lids

arm_group.arm_group_label: ReNu Multiplus and lotrafilcon A lenses
arm_group.description: ReNu Multiplus contact lens care solution

arm_group.arm_group_label: Clear Care solution and lotrafilcon A lenses

intervention.arm_group_label: ReNu Multiplus and lotrafilcon A lenses
Clear Care solution and lotrafilcon A lenses
intervention.other_name: Air Optix Night & Day Aqua contact lenses

intervention.arm_group_label: ReNu Multiplus and lotrafilcon A lenses
Clear Care solution and lotrafilcon A lenses

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. The patient must be at least 15 years old.
2. The patient must be free of any anterior segment disorders.
3. The patient must have a spectacle corrected spherical refractive error between +5.50 D and -11.00 D with less than or equal to 1.00 D refractive cylinder.
4. The patient must be correctable to 20/25 or better with spectacles.
5. Flat and steep corneal curvatures from Simulated Keratometry readings must be between 39.00 and 48.00 D.
6. Can be successfully fit with lotrafilcon A lenses at the enrollment visit.
Exclusion Criteria
1. The patient has worn rigid gas permeable lenses within the last 30 days or polymethylmethacrylate lenses within the last 3 months.
2. The patient must not be a current successful daily wear user of lotrafilcon A lenses. They may have tried lotrafilcon A lenses in the past, but must not have successfully worn these lenses for daily wear within the last 12 months.
3. The patient has an autoimmune disease (except for Hashimoto's Thyroiditis), immunocompromising disease, connective tissue disease, atopic dermatitis, insulin dependent diabetes, or any other systemic disease that in the investigator's opinion will affect ocular health.
4. The patient is taking chronic systemic medications such as corticosteroids, antimetabolites, or non-steroidal anti-inflammatory agents or any other medication that in the investigator's opinion will affect ocular physiology or study participation.
5. The patient has any ocular disease or condition such as aphakia, corneal dystrophies, corneal edema, external ocular infection, iritis, or had any anterior segment surgery.
6. The patient is taking any ocular medications. If a patient was previously taking any ocular medications, the medications must have been discontinued at least 2 weeks prior to enrollment.
7. The patient must have less than or equal to grade 2 on any of the slit lamp observations of: upper tarsal papilla, corneal staining, corneal neovascularization, conjunctival injection, and lid erythema or scales. Slit lamp findings higher than grade 2 bias the patient toward an adverse event and it may be difficult to detect true change related to contact lens use.
8. The patient is pregnant.

facility.name: Department of Ophthalmology University Hospitals Case Medical Center

results_reference.citation: Szczotka-Flynn L, Jiang Y, Raghupathy S, Bielefeld RA, Garvey MT, Jacobs MR, Kern J, Debanne SM. Corneal inflammatory events with daily silicone hydrogel lens wear. Optom Vis Sci. 2014 Jan;91(1):3-12. doi: 10.1097/OPX.0000000000000105.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: From November 2009 to February 2012, 218 participants were randomized at the University Hospitals Case Medical Center Eye Institute.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Existing soft lens wearers or non contact lens wearers were recruited, no wash out period was required

group.title: Lotrafilcon A Lenses and Clear Care
Lotrafilcon A Lenses and Renu Multiplus

baseline.population: The baseline measures refer to the entire cohort of 218 participants that were randomized, stratified by solution group

outcome.title: Number of Participants Developing a Corneal Inflammatory Event (CIE)
outcome.description: Raw number of participants in each solution arm developing CIE over 12 month follow-up period
outcome.population: This primary analysis includes the cohort of all 218 randomized participants. The measured values stratify participants by solution group, however, the statistical analysis reports on the entire cohort (both solution groups) consistent with the primary aim of the study.

group.title: Lotrafilcon A Lenses and Clear Care

measure.title: Number of Participants Developing a Corneal Inflammatory Event (CIE)
measure.description: Raw number of participants in each solution arm developing CIE over 12 month follow-up period
measure.population: This primary analysis includes the cohort of all 218 randomized participants. The measured values stratify participants by solution group, however, the statistical analysis reports on the entire cohort (both solution groups) consistent with the primary aim of the study.

analysis.groups_desc: Cumulative Unadjusted Probability of Remaining Infiltrate Free in entire Cohort

outcome.title: Number of Participants With CIE Stratified by Microbial Bioburden on Lenses
outcome.description: Microbial bioburden on lenses was determined with predetermined cutoffs to identify substantial bioburden as high levels of normal flora or presence of pathogenic abnormal flora on lenses
outcome.population: All participants in which valid lens bioburden data was available

group.title: Participants With Microbial Bioburden on Lenses
Participants Without Microbial Bioburden on Lenses

measure.title: Number of Participants With CIE Stratified by Microbial Bioburden on Lenses
measure.description: Microbial bioburden on lenses was determined with predetermined cutoffs to identify substantial bioburden as high levels of normal flora or presence of pathogenic abnormal flora on lenses
measure.population: All participants in which valid lens bioburden data was available

analysis.groups_desc: To determine if microbial contamination of lenses is a risk factor for CIE
analysis.method_desc: Univariate hazard ratio provided because non-significant finding did not enter into multivariate analyses
analysis.estimate_desc: referent is no substantial lens bioburden

outcome.title: Number of Participants With CIE Based Stratified by Presence or Absence of Corneal Staining Induced by Solution Use.
outcome.description: Presumed solution induced corneal staining was defined as diffuse punctate fluorescein staining of at least 15% surface area in at least 4 of 5 zones
outcome.population: Number of participants with valid presumed solution induced corneal staining data in each group

measure.title: Number of Participants With CIE Based Stratified by Presence or Absence of Corneal Staining Induced by Solution Use.
measure.description: Presumed solution induced corneal staining was defined as diffuse punctate fluorescein staining of at least 15% surface area in at least 4 of 5 zones
measure.population: Number of participants with valid presumed solution induced corneal staining data in each group

analysis.method_desc: Univariate hazard ratio provided because non-significant finding did not enter into multivariate analyses

outcome.title: Number of Participants With CIE Stratified by Microbial Bioburden on Lens Cases
outcome.description: Microbial bioburden within lens storage cases was determined with predetermined cutoffs to identify substantial bioburden as high levels of normal flora or presence of pathogenic abnormal flora
outcome.population: All participants in which valid lens case bioburden data was available

group.title: Participants With Microbial Bioburden on Lens Cases
Participants With no Microbial Bioburden on Lens Cases

measure.title: Number of Participants With CIE Stratified by Microbial Bioburden on Lens Cases
measure.description: Microbial bioburden within lens storage cases was determined with predetermined cutoffs to identify substantial bioburden as high levels of normal flora or presence of pathogenic abnormal flora
measure.population: All participants in which valid lens case bioburden data was available

analysis.method_desc: Univariate hazard ratio provided because non-significant finding did not enter into multivariate analyses
analysis.estimate_desc: referent is no substantial case bioburden

outcome.description: Microbial bioburden on lid margins was determined with predetermined cutoffs to identify substantial bioburden as high levels of normal flora or presence of pathogenic abnormal flora on lids

group.title: Participants With CNS Bioburden on Lid Margins
Participants With no CNS Bioburden on Lid Margins

measure.title: Number of Participants With CIE Stratified by CNS Microbial Bioburden on Lid Margins
measure.description: Microbial bioburden with coagulase negative staphylococci (CNS) on lid margins was determined with predetermined cutoffs to identify substantial bioburden as high levels of normal CNS flora on lids
measure.population: All participants in which valid lids bioburden data was available

analysis.method_desc: Multivariate model adjusted for solution, gender and age
analysis.estimate_desc: referent is no substantial CNS lid bioburden

reported_events.desc: CIE definitions adopted from the standards as listed in the “Institute for Eye Research/L.V. Prasad Eye Institute (IER/LVPEI) Guide To Corneal Infiltrative Conditions Contact Lens Papillary Conjunctivitis was a clinical diagnosis that required temporary or permanent discontinuation of lens wear due to large papilla upon upper lid eversion

group.title: Entire Cohort of Lotrafilcon A Users

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Mostly asymptomatic CIE events occurred which limited the ability to retrieve the lens worn (for culture) precisely at the time of CIE development; this may have hindered our ability to capture bioburden at the time of the adverse event.
